Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 25th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1974...
Had first career hit on 7/25/1979, off John Erickson (BC)...
Won World Championship with Minnesota in 1979...
Hit first career homerun on 5/22/1980, off Kenneth Arent (TOL)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1983, hitting .462 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Hit 3 homeruns against Northeastern, driving in 7 runs on 5/20/1984...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1984, hitting .476 with 5 HR, 13 RBI...
Injured on 9/2/1984 with a Sore Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/14/1985, hitting .455 with 4 HR, 9 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Manchester on 7/18/1987...
Drove in 8 runs against Boston (UBA) on 8/8/1987...
Drove in 6 runs against Manchester on 8/30/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1989, hitting .458 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Ashburn on 2/16/1991 to a 2-year deal worth $436,800 per year...
